ratings.comment: The class is really interesting, and Professor Jones was clearly passionate about the subject but it was unclear as to what was important or what he wanted you to take away from each lecture. The class is curved, which definitely helps and a big part of your grade depends on your TA and how much you participate in discussion.

Will is a great professor. He talks about broader concepts and overlying themes rather than small details. The class requires quite a bit of reading, but some of it is pretty interesting. Exams consist of identifications and an essay, ALL of which are given to you in advance. So as long as you prepare, there's no reason for less than a B

If you are going to take this class be prepared to do A LOT of reading. You have five novels to read over the semester plus whatever textbook/learn@UW he assigns. The lectures have no organization what so ever and you go into the exams not knowing what to expect. Discussion is also unhelpful.

Jones is an easy-going professor.  His lectures were less specifics-based and more open-ended like a large discussion.  Reading is pretty necessary.  Three papers and an 8-page final.  Biggest complaint, too vague and disorganized. Not the worst history professor but not the best.

Professor Jones is a great guy who really cares about his students and knows his history. His lectures offer a lot of information, but the powerpoints aren't online and provide little info. I completely relied on the textbooks (Tons of reading) to learn the course. The TAs are super harsh graders, only grades are essays and participation.

Really good professor. 3 essays and one midterm and final. Be prepared for very large reading assignments though. I could also see his lectures being a bit boring to non-history majors, but if US history is your thing, it's a great class! Pretty good TAs too.

His class is very interesting & he is a great professor. Go to lecture and take notes. Tests are based off several vocab words and one essay based on either the lecture material or the assigned books. You get the vocab words and the question prior to the exams, so the exams are pretty easy. The books he assigns are all really boring though.
Just a Great Guy, Very interesting lectures that are very informative. Made me want to come to class. Overall my favorite college professor thus far

Will is really funny and makes class interesting. His slides don't really allow you to take notes, since it's usually just a picture or a quote, so make sure you go to lecture. That being said, the essays are easy and short, no tests, and the material is interesting. Only negative, the class was way more  political than I expected.

Overall I was fine with this class.  It was a little too much of a political history class, which I didn't care for.  Will is an alright guy.  He can be kind of dull at times and it's hard to take notes on his slides. I did really like how he had us read several novels instead of just history books.  It was a nice change from other history classes.

It is impossible to stay awake in his power lecture. I can take decent notes for about a half hour, then completely lose interest, because he just talks and talks. The slides aren't that helpful in guiding your notes, if you struggle with that. Lectures can be VERY HARD TO FOLLOW.

Take his class... you do have to do a lot of reading, but I read less than half of each book and still ended up with a decent grade. You'll seriously be fine. He's an interesting guy too.. take him if you get the chance!

You read ALOT in this class, and you have to read everything because in discussion sections all you talk about are readings.  You can only miss one discussion and you're graded on your participation in discussion.  Read 6 books and have to write papers on 4 of them (60% of grade) Participation=20% and final=20%.  Not too hard but not a blow off.

his class is relatively easy. his lectures can be hard to follow at times, and power lectures can get long. you are graded on your discussion participation and papers. lectures are way more important than the textbook. take this class--if you are willing to put in a little effort, it will bring up your GPA for sure.
